data.title: University of Houston Athletics
data.meta_description: Jordan Lewis (26) LHP - HONORS & AWARDS 2012 All-Silver Glove Series Team vs. Rice 2011 Commissioner[apos]s Honor Roll 2011 C-USA Pitcher of the Week (April ...
data.text:
HONORS & AWARDS

2012 All-Silver Glove Series Team vs. Rice 2011 Commissioner[apos]s Honor Roll 2011 C-USA Pitcher of the Week (April 25, 2011)

SENIOR (2012)

Made 13 starts on the bump for the Cougars...Appeared in 15 games for second-most as a starter...Was a regular weekend starter for Houston...Recorded a 5.27 ERA...Finished with a record of 3-7...Tossed 70.0 innings for second-most on the team...Struck out 47...Made seven starts in C-USA play...Went 5.0+ innings in eight starts...Fanned a season-high six hitters twice at Rice (May 5) and vs. Memphis (May 18)...Recorded his first win vs. Delaware (Feb. 18); tossed 5.2 scoreless innings...Notched an impressive win over No. 4 Arkansas at the Houston College Classic (March 3); pitched 6.0 innings and allowed just one run on four hits...Picked up third win in a strong outing at Oklahoma State (March 17); tossed 7.0 innings, allowing one run...Fanned four or more hitters in final five starts...Pitched a season-long 8.2 innings vs. Tulane (May 12)...Went back-to-back games, tossing 8.0+ innings at Rice (May 5) and vs. Tulane...Pitched one hitless inning in relief vs. Rice (Feb. 28)...Went 7.0 innings and allowed just two hits and no earned runs in a loss at UAB (April 29)...Named to the All-Silver Glove Series Team vs. Rice JUNIOR (2011)

Made his first Cougar start going seven innings, allowing five hits, no runs with two strikeouts against UT-Arlington (Feb. 19)...Pitched four innings in his second career start, allowing two runs on four hits and had four strikeouts against Ole Miss (Feb. 26)...Went five innings against Kentucky, allowing two runs on three hits with two strikeouts (March 5)...Pitched 2.1 innings, allowing four runs on nine hits with three strikeouts against Texas State (March 12)... Went two innings in a start against McNeese State, allowed three runs on four hits (March 16)...Pitched 6.2 innings against Kent State, allowing three runs on seven hits with four strikeouts (March 19)...Turned in five innings at starter, allowing five runs on six hits with three strikeouts against TCU (March 26)...Pitched 7.1 innings, allowing two runs on nine hits against Tulane (April 2)...Recorded 6.1 innings against UAB, allowing two runs on four hits with five strikeouts (April 9)...Pitched six innings, allowing one run on four hits with three strikeouts in the second game of the doubleheader against Marshall (April 15)...At starter, pitched seven innings , allowing two runs on five hits with 10 strikeouts against East Carolina (April 22)...Pitched a complete game shutout win against UCF (April 30)...C-USA Championship: Pitched 1.1 innings against Southern Miss, allowing one run on three hits with two strikeouts (May 26). WESTERN NEVADA COLLEGE

Played two season under D.J. Whittemore... World Series All-American... Most Valuable Player... First Team All-Conference... Team Pitcher of the Year... Region XVIII First Team selection... Named to the Junior College World Series All-Tournament team... Winningest single-season pitcher in WNC history (12-2; 1.99 ERA)... Team finished third at the Junior College World Series... Named to the NJCAA National All-Star Team. PHOENIX HIGH SCHOOL

Played for head coach Joe Hagler... Earned a First Team All-State selection as a senior... Named the Pitcher of the Year... Holds the career record for strikeouts at Phoenix High School... Member of the National Honor Society... Honor Roll selection all four years. PERSONAL

Full name is Jordan Elliott Lewis... Born June 18, 1990 in Watsonville, Calif... Son of Brian and Terri Lewis... Hobbies include drawing and weightlifting... Majoring in psychology.
